Installs the node_modules on install. If you set user_upload then I assume you know what you are doing.

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# NodeJS App Installation Script
# Server Files: /mnt/server

# Ensure the script is run as root
if [[ $EUID -ne 0 ]]; then
    echo "This script must be run as root"
    exit 1
fi

# Update and install required packages
apt update
apt install -y git curl jq file unzip make gcc g++ python3 python3-dev libtool

# Set up the server directory
mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

# Mark /mnt/server as a safe Git directory to avoid 'dubious ownership' warnings
git config --global --add safe.directory /mnt/server

# Ensure GIT_ADDRESS environment variable is set
if [ -z "${GIT_ADDRESS}" ]; then
    echo "Error: GIT_ADDRESS is not set."
    exit 1
fi

# Ensure GIT_ADDRESS ends in .git
if [[ ${GIT_ADDRESS} != *.git ]]; then
    GIT_ADDRESS="${GIT_ADDRESS}.git"
fi

# Configure git address with credentials if provided
if [ -n "${USERNAME}" ] && [ -n "${ACCESS_TOKEN}" ]; then
    GIT_ADDRESS="https://${USERNAME}:${ACCESS_TOKEN}@$(echo ${GIT_ADDRESS} | cut -d/ -f3-)"
else
    echo "Using anonymous API call"
fi

# Check if the /mnt/server directory is empty
if [ "$(ls -A /mnt/server)" ]; then
    echo "/mnt/server directory is not empty."

    # Check if a git repository exists
    if [ -d .git ] && [ -f .git/config ]; then
        echo "Loading info from git config"
        ORIGIN=$(git config --get remote.origin.url || echo "")

        # Debugging output for ORIGIN and GIT_ADDRESS comparison
        echo "Remote origin URL: ${ORIGIN}"
        echo "Provided GIT_ADDRESS: ${GIT_ADDRESS}"

        # Add or update remote origin if it doesn't match GIT_ADDRESS
        if [ -z "${ORIGIN}" ]; then
            echo "No remote origin found. Adding remote origin."
            git remote add origin "${GIT_ADDRESS}"
        elif [ "${ORIGIN}" != "${GIT_ADDRESS}" ]; then
            echo "Remote origin does not match GIT_ADDRESS. Updating remote origin to ${GIT_ADDRESS}."
            git remote set-url origin "${GIT_ADDRESS}"
        fi

        echo "Fetching all branches from remote"
        git fetch --all

        # Switch to the specified branch if provided, default to develop if not
        TARGET_BRANCH="${BRANCH:-develop}"
        echo "Switching to branch ${TARGET_BRANCH}"
        git checkout -B "${TARGET_BRANCH}" --track "origin/${TARGET_BRANCH}" || git checkout "${TARGET_BRANCH}"
        git pull
    else
        echo "Directory has files but no git config. Exiting to avoid breaking anything."
        exit 10
    fi
else
    # Clone the repository if directory is empty, fetching all branches
    echo "/mnt/server is empty. Cloning all branches."
    git clone "${GIT_ADDRESS}" .
    git checkout ${BRANCH:-develop}  # Default to 'develop' if BRANCH is not specified
fi

# Download additional scripts
echo "Downloading additional scripts..."
curl -o sentry.sh https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SiviumSolutions/node-script/main/sentry.sh
curl -o start.sh https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SiviumSolutions/node-script/main/start.sh
curl -o check.sh https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SiviumSolutions/node-script/main/check.sh
curl -o nginx.sh https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SiviumSolutions/node-script/main/nginx.sh
curl -o install.sh https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SiviumSolutions/node-script/main/install.sh
mkdir -p /.acme /.ssl

# Check if acme.sh is already installed, if not, install it
if [ ! -f /mnt/server/.acme/acme.sh ]; then
    echo "acme.sh is not installed. Installing..."
    git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/acmesh-official/acme.sh.git
    cd acme.sh
    ./acme.sh --install --force \
        --home /mnt/server/.acme \
        --config-home /mnt/server/.acme/data \
        --cert-home /mnt/server/.ssl \
        --accountkey /mnt/server/.acme/account.key \
        --accountconf /mnt/server/.acme/account.conf \
        --useragent "this is my client."
    cd ..
    rm -rf acme.sh  # Remove the cloned acme.sh Git directory
else
    echo "acme.sh is already installed."
fi

# Make the scripts executable
cd /mnt/server
chmod +x sentry.sh start.sh check.sh nginx.sh install.sh .acme/acme.sh

echo -e "\nInstall and version verification complete"
